title.value: Продуктивность севооборотов и изменение агрохимических показателей дерново-подзолистой супесчаной почвы при длительном применении удобрений
Crop rotation productivity and change of agrochemical properties of sod-podzolic loamy sand soil under long-term fertilization

journal.title: Soil Science and Agrochemistry : scientific journal

person.name: Ivakhnenko, N.N., National Academy of Sciences. Scientific and Practical Center for Arable Farming (Belarus). Institute for Soil Science and Agrochemistry

abstract.value: In a long-term (1995-2010) stationary field experiment on sod-podzolic loamy sand soil in three crop rotations the effect of different levels and correlations of mineral fertilization on the productivity of agricultural crops and dynamics soil agrochemical properties was studied. The research was realized in the conditions of the Republic of Belarus in the Republican Unitary Enterprise 'Suvorov Experimental Base' in Uzda of Minsk region. As a result of realized research it was found that the maximum crop productivity (8.2 t of f.u./ha) was ensured at the average annual application of N90P40K89 in combination with 12.1 t/ha of manure. During the investigated period (14 years), the contents of mobile phosphorus and potassium forms (Kirsanov) decreased in variant with the optimum productivity by 16 and 54 mg/kg soil, respectively, and the soil acidity increased by 0.68 pH units, the content of humus being remained stable. Experimental design and fertilizer distribution on 3 crop rotations, productivity of grain-hoed, gain-grass-hoed and grain-grass crop rotations on sod-podzolic sandy loam soil in 1995-2010 were presented. Average annual balance of nutrients for 3 crop rotations in sod-podzolic sandy loam soil, variation of agrochemical indices of arable layer of sod-podzolic sandy loam soil at cultivation of grain-hoed, gain-grass-hoed and grain-grass crop rotations in 1995-2010 were shown.
